event.name: MORPH_ZOLTAN
event.text: A Zoltan science vessel is in this region. "We've been reading some very intriguing scientific reports about this region, but unfortunately there's not that much information that has been disclosed to the Ministry. We're hoping to write a survey paper for a journal. Have you seen any interesting phenomena unique to this region?"

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Share your advanced sensor readings with them.

event.text: "I see, these are some interesting readings. We'll do what we can with these."

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Show them your advanced sensor readings.

event.text: "I see, these are some interesting readings. We'll do what we can with these."

choice.text: (Mafan) Admonish the scientists for their cowardice.

event.text:
"You call yourselves researchers? You're hailing a Federation Renegade - we're not the ones you should be talking to! Go do your jobs and get in that nebula! I'll send you some directions, but you have to do the work yourself."
The Zoltans look ashamed. "Yes Dr. Vadis... We hope you'll... overlook our embarrassing moment."

choice.text: (Shell Scientist) Encourage your Shell Scientist to share some of their research.

event.text: Your Scientist sighs and agrees to share whatever information they can get away with, but insists on being properly credited as an author. The Zoltans accept this agreement.

choice.text: (Alkali) Encourage Alkali to grant them access to his research.

event.text:
Alkali looks at you strangely and rolls his eye. "Fine, but only if it's worthhhh it." He then jumps onto the call to talk to the Ministry scientists. "Who is the head researcher over thhhhere? I'm not going to help some hack - but if thhhhey're worthhhhy, we can work something out."
"Uh, yes, I'll send over her portfolio right away... she's still back in Zoltan space right now."
Alkali goes over her file, looking over the papers she'd worked on and contributions she'd made. After a few minutes he nods and gets back on. "I'll send you some of my research. You'd better write a very glowing 'Acknowledgements' section about me!" The Zoltans seem all too happy to agree to this, and give you a handsome reward of scrap.
The captain of the Zoltan vessel shows his appreciation with an extra gift.

choice.text: (Morph Crew) Show them your Morph crewmember.

event.text: "So this is what they've been hiding in that nebula! Fascinating. We'll take a few readings and let you be on your way!"
The Ministry already has enough shady secrets, they have no need to get into this. These scientists will be no match for your weapons.

choice.text: Tell them you have nothing to show them.

event.text: "We'll keep looking then."

event.name: MORPH_SLUG
event.text: You jump in, expecting to find a ship in distress. Instead, you see a Slug Clansman chewing on some alien popcorn. "Oh, hey watssssup man."
"Oh, yeahhhh that. There wassss sssome Morphsss here a minute ago. Think I ssscared them off tho-" The Slug is cut off when the Morph ship comes flying back, firing on the Slug hull!
There's probably a valid reason for the Morphs attacking these Clansmen... but nonetheless you aren't going to let it happen!

You can imagine why the Morphs are mad - Clansmen aren't known for being friendly to their fellow nebula dwellers... or anyone for that matter. You won't let them become the Guild's next prey. You prepare to defend the Morphs!

choice.text: Alright fun chat, time to leave.
Obviously, they aren't in danger anymore. Leave.

event.text: These Clansmen likely are attempting to lower your guard just to shoot you when you won't expect it. It's better to leave them to be entertained by this sector's unpredictable inhabitants.
It appears the Clansman ship was destroyed in the fight. Little remains but scrap matter for you to take.
It looks as though the Clansman ship took a beating during the fight... but the Slug onboard is still alive. "Ayyy yo my ssship isss totaled. Gonna hang with you now if that'ssss alright."

event.name: MORPH_RUINS
event.text: Though Shells usually stick to the nebulas, it seems a Shell research outpost was set up here previously. It's heavily damaged though, but maybe something is left?

You move closer to the wreck, but are stopped when a mechanic ship flies past. "Hey, is thhhhat really necessary? You're only making our job harder. Management always gets thhhhe worst jobs! I'd rather be scooping out equinoid brains or fighting off Slugs, but yet here I am. Do us a favor and leave thhhhat station alone, would you?"

You ignore the Shells, scooping up all that you can. The ship watches in growing anger, and their captain finally snaps. "Alright, damn you to hell. We have a job to do, and you've officially crossed the line!"

"Oh, wow. Thhhhat's quite helpful! Why can't thhhe council authhhhorize us better funding? Ugh, I hate thhhis job. You know what? I quit! I'm withhh you now. What are you gonna do about it, huh Director Nerva? Oh man, it feels so good to say thhhat..."

"Oh, wow. Thhhhat's quite efficient! Why can't thhhe council authhhhorize us using thhhose? Ugh, I hate thhhis job. You know what? I quit! I'm withhh you now. What are you gonna do about it, huh Director Nerva? Oh man, it feels so good to say thhhat..."

choice.text: (Hull Repair Drone) Fix up the station. [-1|]

event.text: "Oh, wow. Thhhhat's quite efficient! Why can't thhhe council authhhhorize us using thhhose? Ugh, I hate thhhis job. You know what? I quit! I'm withhh you now. What are you gonna do about it, huh Director Nerva? Oh man, it feels so good to say thhhat..."

"Oh, wow. Thhhhat's quite efficient! Why can't thhhe council authhhhorize us using thhhose? Ugh, I hate thhhis job. You know what? I quit! I'm withhh you now. What are you gonna do about it, huh Director Nerva? Oh man, it feels so good to say thhhat..."

"Oh, wow. Thhhhat's quite efficient! Why can't thhhe council authhhhorize us using thhhose? Ugh, I hate thhhis job. You know what? I quit! I'm withhh you now. What are you gonna do about it, huh Director Nerva? Oh man, it feels so good to say thhhat..."

"Oh, wow. Thhhhat's quite efficient! What even is thhhat, and where did you find it? Ugh, I hate thhhis job. You know what? I quit! I'm withhh you now. What are you gonna do about it, huh Director Nerva? Oh man, it feels so good to say thhhat..."
One man's trash is another man's trash too. What could be left worth taking anyways?

event.name: MORPH_PIRATE_INSANE
event.text: Before you can go any further, you're stopped by a pirate vessel. "Have you heard the news!? Our new gods, the Morphs, have risen! The great one himself, oh mighty OOJ MAJOO has been freed from captivity! Do you have an offering for the gods, or will you live a life of regretful sin?!"
"You are wise! I have all certainty the great OOJ MAJOO shall bless you! As a devout believer in the Morphs, I shall grant you passage, and aid in your travels!"
The pirate does extensive work on your hull, and offers an augment to appease you.

"Oh sweet heavens, you're one of them! I am so sorry my lord for not recognizing you!" The pirate falls to his knees, pleading for forgiveness. You promise to spare him so long as he hands over one of the weapons in his storage.
The pirate screeches in rage, and powers up his weapons. You should do the same.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_MORPH_SOLAR
event.text: Shells aren't normally ones for unmanned tech, and you don't normally see full sized stars deep in the nebula either. Despite both of these things being uncommon, it seems you've run into both! A small Shell solar energy collection device is orbiting the star. Inside are several power cells you might be able to interface with... if you can figure the machine out.

choice.text: Take your chance and interface with the device.

event.text: It's too risky, especially this close to a star. You'll have to jump away as soon as you can.
You manage to break open the device, but the power cells are fried. Too damaged to be any worth in your reactor, but you can repurpose them into fuel. Better than nothing.
Somehow you get the process right, and interface directly with the machine. You drain as much power as you can for yourself, which will do good work for your reactor.
You simply can't figure out how the machine works. You fiddle with it for a little longer, but a flare from the star strikes your ship, causing some damage. You give up and hurry to leave.
You play with the machine for a while, and eventually manage to pull out the cells to repurpose as fuel. Unfortunately, a stray science vessel has spotted you... and they aren't happy!
Your Shell knows exactly how this machine works, and they retrieve the power cells to install into your reactor. This will give it a nice boost!

Your Shell knows exactly how this machine works, and they retrieve the power cells to install into your reactor. This will give it a nice boost! Unfortunately, a stray science vessel has spotted you... and they aren't happy!

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_JUICE
event.text: A Shell vessel outfitted for cargo purposes is attempting to navigate the thicker clouds nearby. You catch chatter on the comms concerning their cargo, which seems to be high value. From what you can hear, it appears they're afraid of getting lost in the nebula.

The two Shells turn to look at you, surprised to find someone else here. "Oh. A Renegade. And thhhey aren't killing us? How strange. Maybe you can help. We're currently transporting a shipment of Quarp Juice to Site Omega, but thhhis storm is in our way. Do you happen to have any alternate flight paths thhhere?"
The Shells immediately mute you and carry on arguing with each other.

"You've never heard of Quarp Juice? It's thhhis miracle substance Professor Alkali discovered that thhhe Union was selling! Invented by some genius scientist named Ellie! We used it to make thhhe Morphs. Which uh... didn't turn out so well, sure, but thhhey aren't selling thhhhe stuff anymore and it's incredibly expensive. We had a couple warehhhouses of it left and we're moving it before it gets blown up by Rebels."
The Shells immediately mute you and carry on arguing with each other.

choice.text: If their cargo is valuable, let's take it!

event.text: You aren't quite sure what they're exactly carrying, but you sure wouldn't mind taking it!
With nothing of interest to do with the transport, you simply mute their frequencies and carry on.
"Wow, your databanks are quite extensive. And so I thought we Shells were the only ones with thhhe observational skills to record such thhhorough data. Thhhank you for this. Allow us to assist you."
"Wow, your databanks are quite extensive. And so I thought we Shells were the only ones with thhhe observational skills to record such thhhorough data. Thhhank you for this. Allow us to assist you."
"Wow, your databanks are quite extensive. And so I thought we Shells were the only ones with thhhe observational skills to record such thhhorough data. Thhhank you for this. Allow us to assist you."

event.name: MORPH_JUICE_ALKALI
event.text: You expect Alkali to offer help to the scientists or at least some words of reaffirment, but instead he only proceeds to insult the pair for their incompetence. Ashamed (and also afraid of being fired) the Shells profusely apologize and offer you everything they can spare to settle Alkali's anger.

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_PEEPEEPOOPOO
event.text: A hail from the nearest Morph ship bears an odd message. "Pee pee poo poo." To you, this sounds like nothing more than a crude joke. But for all you know, to the Morphs this could be profound.

choice.text: Take some time to decipher it.

event.text: You spend hours analyzing what it could mean. You work your brain, trying every possible angle to look for. At last, you give up. It seems the true meaning of pee pee poo poo shall forever remain lost to you. Fortunately, your efforts don't go entirely in vain, and the Morph seems to appreciate your thoughtfulness and gives you a small chunk of scrap.

choice.text: (Morph Crew) Have your Morph explain this meaning to you.

event.text: Your Morph speaks to you for a long time, revealing the universe's inner secrets. The answer to your every problem, the meaning of the universe itself, it is all held tight in this one simple, unassuming phrase. Unfortunately, you don't understand your crewmate's speech either. You suppose these secrets shall remain forever lost to you. Fortunately, this wisdom is not lost on the other ship, who offers a chunk of scrap for being so wise.
You aren't going to let the Morphs insult you like this! You open fire.

choice.text: It's nothing more than crass and crude.

event.text: You do not believe such a phrase could hold any importance. You abandon this thought experiment and carry on.

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_ENGINEER_TECHNO
event.text: It appears the nearby Engineer ship isn't attacking you just yet. Instead, they hail. "You know, I should attack you. But frankly, I just want to brag to someone about my latest achievement!"

"You've probably heard of or seen the Technopaths by now. They're like the Morphs, but they can take the form of noncarbon entities instead! Well, I thought it would be a great idea to start replacing my drones with some. It's almost exactly the same amount of efficiency, but without any of the power usage! It's great!"

choice.text: Acknowledge their success and carry on.

event.text: You're only trying to carry on to the next beacon, but the Engineer seems so happy you acknowledged him, he even offers you some free drone parts.

choice.text: We aren't here for stories. Attack the engineers!

event.text: You won't show these Rebels mercy just because they want to talk!
You mute the Engineers and carry on your way.
You attempt to mute the engineers, but that only agitates them. They attack!

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_SMUGGLER_CONFUSED
event.text: Nearby is a smuggler, flying through the nebula. Perhaps they have something of value to offer?

You expect a simple response from the vessel, but instead you receive a loud screech, followed by the shout of one of your crew. You run to their location where you see a frightened smuggler holding a pistol to their face. "You- you're one of them Morphs, ain't ya! Don't play no damn tricks on me!

choice.text: (Clone Bay) There's no risk here. Blast the asshole and carry on.

event.text: You draw your blaster, shooting the smuggler, but not before he shoots your own crew. Luckily, there indeed is no risk, and your crew comes back perfectly fine. The smuggler ship now inoperable, you scrap some of its hull.

The smuggler screams, horrified at the sight of an actual Morph on your ship. Firing widly, he causes some damage to your ship, but you're able to subdue him. With his ship now inoperable, you scrap some of the hull.
You doubt they have anything to offer thats worth your time.

You talk in a slow, calming voice as you approach the smuggler. This seems to relax him, giving you enough time to grab him and snap his neck. Job well done? With the smuggler out of the way, you loot his pockets and find some resources.

"Hey, you ain't talkin' no gibberish! Tha's good... tha's good... If you ain't no blob though, you outta be careful, them blobs everywhere! It ain't no safe place travelin along, think I oughta come with you folks..."
"You talk real damn good for an impostor!" The smuggler swivels to shoot you, but you manage to jump out of the way. Soon you find yourself in a fight!

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_FREEGUN
event.text: Holy crap! A weapon is just floating in space! Sure it's a storm, but a gun is a gun!

choice.text: Our luck is never this good. Leave it.

event.text: God knows what that "gun" could be. You leave it behind and carry on.
Looks like the weapon was real after all!
You draw the weapon onboard, only for it to stir and suddenly split into several separate Technopaths!

You draw the weapon onboard, only for a Morph vessel to come stumbling out of the clouds, yelling "AKOO BLAT TRI TROO KAPAT RETEROO!" Looks like bringing this weapon onboard has angered them somehow... and it's apparent why. The weapon is in fact another Morph, but they don't seem nearly as hostile as the shouting ship!

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_SHELL_REFUGEE_SCIENCE
event.text: It looks like a Shell vessel is approaching...

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_SHELL_REFUGEE_IMPOSTOR
event.text: It looks like a Shell vessel is approaching...

event.name: MORPH_SHELL_REFUGEE_SCIENCE
event.text: It looks like the Shell ship is a science vessel. They beg you for help. "Thhhhe Rebels, thhhey've been following us everywhere! Would you be so kind as to aid us?"

choice.text: Offer them some supplies to better prepare themselves.

event.text: You give the Shells some missiles and droneparts to help them...
"Oh, you are most generous! You have our best wishes. Here, accept this gift."
Never one to shy away from casual needless murder, you power up the weapons and attack the Shells.
You apologize but have nothing to offer. The Shells nod and carry on.
The Shells are reluctant to trust you to such a degree, and ultimately decline. With nothing else to do, they fly away, leaving you with some time on your hands.
The Shells appreciate the offer and accept. Though most you drop off at a nearby Shell station, one of them wishes to stay behind.
The Shells are reluctant, but ultimately agree. Once dropped off at a nearby station, they offer you some scrap as pay.

event.name: MORPH_SHELL_REFUGEE_IMPOSTER
event.text: It looks like the Shell ship is a science vessel. They beg you for help. "The Rebels, they've been following us everywhere! Would you be so kind as to aid us?"
As soon as their crew step aboard, it's apparent that those Shells... they're Rebels! It was a trap all along!

choice.text: Offer them some supplies to better prepare themselves.

event.text: You give the Shells some missiles and droneparts to help them...
"Oh, you really are stupid after all! It was a trap, idiots!" The ship turns hostile, revealing itself to be piloted by Rebels!
You expect protesting from the Shell vessel, but instead you're met with angry shouts from a Rebel captain! "Damn it, how did you know it was a trap?!"
The Shell ship stays suspiciously silent for a moment, followed by them raising their weapons. A Rebel captain appears on the vidscreen. "Ahahah, it was a trap all along!"

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_BLOCKADE
event.text: When you first jump in, you assume this to be a simple, empty nebula, but such a hope is betrayed when a militant vessel comes out of the clouds. "Hey, didn't you hear Prof. Alkali's warning? Thhhhis sector is dangerous. Thhhhhis beacon is under quarantine. I suggest you move it."

choice.text: You can't tell us what to do!

event.text: You'll be damned if you let anyone tell you where you can and can't go. You arm the weapons and prepare for battle.

choice.text: (Alkali) We are carrying a VIP right now.

event.text: Once the militants learn about the situation, they stop bothering you, and even offer supplies before saying farewell.
You power down the weapons and prepare to leave the system as soon as you can.

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_AUTOSCIENCECHOICE
event.text: A short range distress signal is being emitted from a Shell science station nearby, which is under attack by a Rebel Auto-ship!
You attack the Auto vessel.
You don't have the time to play hero right now and help the Shells.
"Your timing is most convenient! Thank you, Federation. May this heal your wounds."
It appears the Shells did not make it. All you can do is scrap the hull of the station.

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_MORPH_REBEL_JAMMED
event.text: Of all things, you didn't expect to see a Rebel ship being the one to solicit their distress beacon on open comms. They don't seem shy to hail you either. "You know that gross sentient space gunk that lives here? Well some of their goopy insides got all stuck in our engines, and now they're jammed. Now I know we don't exactly get along, but there surely could be something in it for you!"

choice.text: Try and fix up their engines.
There couldn't be a better opportunity to attack!

event.text: If they don't have engines, there's nowhere these Rebels can run! Still they try, but it's pointless.

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Have your engineer take a look at the engines.

event.text: Fortunately, your engineer clears out the Morphs quickly, and the Rebels seem impressed. "Hmmm... you've helped us more than we expected. I suppose the act of not murdering us is worthy of some pay as promised."

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Have your Engi take a look at the engines.

event.text: Fortunately, your Engi clears out the Morphs quickly, and the Rebels seem impressed. "Hmmm... you've helped us more than we expected. I suppose the act of not murdering us is worthy of some pay as promised."

choice.text: (Morph Crew) Have your Morph reawaken the hibernating goo.

event.text: Your Morph lets out a cacophony of shrill chirping, followed by many more from the Morphs in the engines, who detach themselves from the mechanism and roll to meet your Morph. The Rebels aren't really sure what they just witnessed, but they reluctantly pay you in "thanks".
Knowing the Rebels, this could just as well be yet another trap. Atleast, they don't seem to follow you.
It's not easy work, but you chip away at the goo with the help of the Rebels. Eventually, you finally scoop out all of the goo, and the Rebels' engines spark to life once again.
It's back-breaking work, and to no avail. The goo simply won't come out, and it becomes clear these engines aren't going to recover...
"Great work! Too bad I'm afraid we're still going to have to alert the fleet on your location!" The Rebel ship speeds off, and you chase after them!
"Hmmm... you've helped us more than we expected. I suppose the act of not murdering us is worthy of some pay as promised."
"Bah, you're worthless. What was I thinking, expecting help from a Fed ship?"

"Though you have proven yourself unable to assist, your willingness to help is most remarkable. As my ship is thoroughly ruined, it would appear my options are either to wait here for some miracle, or to go with you instead. I don't believe in miracles, so I only see one valid option."

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_MORPH_SLICE
event.text: The distress call nearby seems to be coming from a Mantis vessel, whose captain frantically screams at you. "HELP, HELP, HELP HELP HELP HELP! ME TRYING SLICE UP BLOB, BLOB BECOME MORE BLOB! NOW BLOB EVERYWHERE! SO MANY! AAAAAAAAAGH!"

choice.text: Help rid their ship of the Morphs.

event.text: If you're expecting any kind of reward, you'll have to be careful not to destroy the ship!

choice.text: (Boarding Drone) Send the drone in to eradicate the Morphs.
Leave the Mantis to their troubles.

event.text: You do not see any reason to help the Mantis. The Hive has clashed with mightier foes than agitated slimes in the past; they can deal with this on their own.
Your boarding drone makes quick work of the blobs. Once eradicated, the Mantis thanks you and gives you a decent reward.
It appears you didn't plan for the Morphs mimicking your own drone - a Technopath takes the shape of your boarder, and blasts it into pieces! Disparaged, you consider your options.
If you're expecting any kind of reward, you'll have to be careful not to destroy the ship!

choice.text: Ignore the Mantis, there's nothing else to do.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_MORPH
textList.text: "KALPU! KALPU! RETER LIP LOO TIKA TIKA BOO!" An irate Morph begins to fling insults you can only imagine are incredibly vulgar in their language. You have literally no idea what you did to anger them though. Maybe just existing is enough to offend them?
As yet another hostile Morph vessel approaches, you can't help but wonder if the Shells never actually finished "designing" their temperament. What else could explain how erratic they are?
You receive a video with a gibberish title which shows several cartoon alien warriors fighting each other in gladiatorial combat. Minutes later, a Morph ship approaches, weapons on the ready.
Something tells you the nearby Morph ship isn't friendly. It might be the aggressive shouting, or their charging weapons. Just a hunch, though.
These aggressive Morphs really set a bad image for the rest of their kind. At least they don't yell "Hey, you're that Federation ship!" every time they see you.
You wonder if the Morphs are even aware who you are, or what your mission is. Unfortunately, "booj kabooj" is not an indicative answer as their vessel opens fire.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_MORPH
textList.text: The Rebellion's sudden interest in these small, grey, unassuming blobs is concerning. It seems to have drawn a lot of their ships here too, such as the one here currently moving into fighting you!
"Hey, you're that Federation ship! Stop right there-" You mute the Rebel vessel. All of these lackeys are the same, they might as well be Morphs themselves.
Something isn't right about this nebula. A sliver of orange slips through the clouds, and your body goes into alert. Rebel vessel inbound!
There's never a dull moment in this sector. This time it appears your foe will be a Rebel. Is it better than a Shell or Morph? Time will tell...

Rebels aren't all too common nowadays outside of sectors of interest or the fleet trailing you, which means if anything the ship here is a sign of something bigger. Beyond that, it's also a sign there's a fight in your very near future!
You gave up your past self to become the brave Multiverse Renegade who'd save the Federation. Now, a Rebel ship moves into your path to stop you. Show them how you get things done.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_AUTO_MORPH
textList.text: "Detecting for samples of substance M4-RH. Error. Reprocessing vessel. Federation ship detected. Activating 'sweet jesus that's an enemy' protocol." An Auto-ship quickly transitions from recon to combat mode. Prepare for battle!

You've seen several Rebel vessels prowling about here already, but this time it appears your foe is an automated vessel! Good thing this nebula is keeping you on your toes, because you've already started charging the weapons.
The Atlas entry said the Rebel threat here was high, and these Auto-ships are a clear sign of it. How much property damage will you cause the Rebels today?
"This beacon is under Rebellion control. Federation vessels will not be tolerated." An Auto-vessel moves in. If the Shells haven't taken care of this scrapbucket yet, then you will.
Thankfully, though it's sometimes hard to spot the grey wings of an Auto-ship slipping through the dark nebula, their distinct orange glow gives them away. Get ready for a fight!

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_SHELL_SCIENTIST_MORPH
event.text: Normally Shell ships are reasonably passive, especially the scientists. However, the ship here doesn't follow that example. "Damn it, we already have to deal with thhhhe Rebels here! We didn't ask for Federation intervention!"

surrender.text: "Ok, ok! I've changed my mind! You can take us alive!"

choice.text: Demand they explain what's going on.

event.text: "We uh... were offered a lot of money by thhhhe Rebels to transfer over some blueprints, cargo, and Morph DNA. Like, a lot of money. Don't look at me like that! Had you been offered the same, you would have done it too!"

"Please don't use thhhe term 'alien'. To us, YOU are thhhe aliens. But... yes, thhhey aren't thhhe kindest folk. But rich as hell! Thhhhey aren't above a basic buyout, easier thhhan raiding an entire sector. Unfortunately... now you're here. And our payment never showed up..."

choice.text: Demand they give you the cargo instead. If the Rebels have use for it, so does the Federation.

event.text: "What?! But what about our money!" You flip a switch to power back on your weapons, and the Shell gulps in anticipation. "Ah... right. Alright fine. I'm so fired for thhhis... Well, I was going to be fired for thhhis anyways. But you get thhhe point. It's like being 'double fired'."

event.name: MORPH_SITE_DELTA
event.text: It looks like a massive Shell laboratory has been set up here, and it's still functional! However, you can't help but wonder how it survived this long under the Rebel siege.

You receive a response from a frightened Shell scientist. "Crap! You'll never take us alive, Federation!" The station suddenly opens fire without any further reason why. Maybe if you can damage them enough, they'll surrender and you can figure out what's going on.
You have better things to do than bother these Shells.

event.name: MORPH_SITE_DELTA_FAIL
event.text: Looks like you ended up killing the Shells after all. Now nothing remains but some salvage.

event.name: MORPH_SITE_DELTA_UNLOCK
event.text: True to what the Shell said, if the Rebellion has use for this, so will the Federation. For the blueprint, you forward them to the Federation base. The weapon you take with you, and the Morph DNA you lock away for safe keeping. The Rebels don't need to get their hands on this...

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_SITE_ALPHA
event.text: Looks like this is... or was, the site of a Shell laboratory. Apparently something important no less, as it's marked "Site Alpha" on your map. Looks like it's been damaged by Rebels though, and a single ship still remains.

choice.text: Attack them to access the lab.

event.text: The Rebel ship is slow to the offense, and says nothing. All the same, they raise their weapons and attack!
This place has already been ransacked. No reason getting involved when we won't get much out of it anyways.

event.name: MORPH_SITE_ALPHA_ENTER
event.text: Another Rebel ship laid to waste by you and your crew. You scrap the hull before you investigate the lab.

You're surprised to find a still functional terminal in one of the rooms. It appears to have been half-way through sending a message until it was disabled by the Rebels. You download the information and play it back on your ship...

"Thhhe final containment unit has been breached. Rebel forces have descended on Site Alpha, and have stolen subject 0. We are requesting immediate backup, an MFK Ace has already arrived. I repeat, we are requesting immediate ba-" The recording cuts short, but you can easily guess how it ended. Nothing pretty, to be certain. Looks like some coordinates are on here too, a tracking beacon on this supposed subject 0.

event.name: SURRENDER_OOJ_UNLOCK
event.text: Suddenly, a voice bursts out of the Rebel ship, though it's oddly unhuman, but you can't place your finger on why. "StOp! THis shIp dosnot want TO fight. Please-stofiring. Please. Please. Please."
"T-hank yOu. You are... so KInd." It suddenly dawns on you what's off. The voice is spliced together from other audio tracks. It's not even a person speaking, but a bizarre recording.
You don't receive a response for a while, and you begin to think they've ignored you, when suddenly the 'voice' returns. "CaNI trusyou?"
"Thiship- Not REbEls. I am... OO-JMA-JOO. Fatherof MOrpHs. We arescaping. The Shells ARE not-kind. They waNT to-use us forslave labor. WILL you allow usaftety? When I am-safe the Morphs will BE too."

choice.text: Agree to take him with you.

event.text: You expect a Morph to beam aboard, but instead the Rebel ship changes shape, converging into a massive grey blob. "Itappears I AM too large. To fit. I wishforyou TO carRY this segmentof My body. FEEd it so IT may grow. THank YOU, FedERATION."

choice.text: We aren't the right people for this task.

event.text: "I... UNDER stand. Thank youfor not KIlling me." The Rebel ship spits out a weapon, then jumps away.
The ship stops, then immediately jumps away. Guess you scared them off, idiot.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_OOJMAJOO
event.text: Looks like this is the ship carrying the supposed subject zero. Much like the ship before, it makes no attempt to brag, threaten, or insult you like a normal Rebel ship would, but silently moves past.
You can't even be certain if this "subject 0" is still onboard or not, but you aren't going to let these Rebels go without a fight!

Your Morph crew seems to have something to say, but you can't understand them. As you listen to them spouting nonsense, you accidentally bump hulls with the MFK Ace. The ship suddenly turns hostile and attacks!
It's not often you see a Rebel ship like this, but you don't feel like fighting today.

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_SITE_OMEGA
event.text: You've arrived at Site Omega, the location mentioned by Alkali at the entrance. You spot a large Shell laboratory in the distance, and approach cautiously.
Oddly enough, it appears the gas in the facility has been shut off. It's extremely convenient, but you aren't one to question. You dock with the station and head inside...

The interior hallways are mixed in splashes of red and green blood as you carefully step over the mangled corpses of humans and crumbled bodies of deceased Shells. Looks like a massive firefight happened here, though the uniform on these Rebels stands out... Not one to back down though, you press on, following the trail of carnage.

At last, you reach a locked door, and once you break it open you spot a wounded Shell scientist on the ground, presumably Alkali. As soon as he spots you, he points at a table with a syringe on it. "You. Give me thhhat..."

choice.text: No. You're going to answer some questions first.

event.text: Alkali glares at you, and you aren't even sure if he heard you. "Didn't you hear me? Grab me thhhhat syringe. I don't have time to waste."

choice.text: This is a bad idea. Ignore the station.

event.text: If this place had to go on lockdown, it can't mean anything good.

event.name: ALKALI_LORE
event.text: You quickly administer the brown liquid in the syringe into Alkali's arm. "Good, I just needed something to boost my regenerative properties again. Now, why is thhhe Federation intruding in thhhis sector? I didn't realize thhhe ongoings of thhhe Geniocracy concerned you when you seem much more preoccupied withhh... othhher matters."

choice.text: Could ask the same about why the Rebels are here.

event.text: "Yes, I was wondering thhhe same thhhhing. Thhhey've taken an interest in our... my latest mistakes. Thhhe Morphhhs, you see, were created to work for thhhe Shells. Do thhhe hard, manual labor. A work of god damn genius, too! All it took was a bit of Quarp Juice and soon enough I had created LIFE ITSELF! Damn Nerva, thhhe Management District's director, kept refusing to approve funding for thhhe project! Probably thhhought thhe Morphhhs were going to make them useless, much like thhhhe Radiants for thhhe Military District..."

"I wouldn't be surprised if thhhhat bitch sabotaged my facilities! But thhhat's just rumor among thhhe science district... Now, you still have not answered my question. Why are you here? I do not appreciate thhhe unknown staying unknown, and I would like to understand your intentions before you shoot me or sacrifice me to whatever pagan gods you people worship."

choice.text: We're on a quest to reach Node 17.

event.text: "Well no shit, everyone knows WHERE you're going. I swear, everyone is heading to thhhhat forsaken place. A disgrace! You could have used thhhat MV tech to, I don't know, solve ancient mysteries or create some sort of interdimensional utopia. But instead you use it to fight each othhher. We Shells do not suffer from thhhese issues. We are people of science, and have little to worry about internal conflict. Now, you still have not answered me. Have you come to kill me? Recruit me to cure some form of deadly space disease your people suffer from? God damn it, I'm tired of waiting."

choice.text: We heard your distress call and came here.

event.text: "Ah, some kind of philanthropist, are you? Great, well I guess you're a better escort thhhan... I dunno, somethhhing thhhat's worse thhhan you. You don't subscribe to any silly religions or conspiracies do you? You are vaccinated, right?"
"Very good thhhen. I request thhhat you transport me back to thhhe Geniocracy when you have a chance. I shall make myself useful in thhhhe meantime. I am no freeloader."

I am Professor Alkali Mardovar, but I'm sure you've heard of my work as I've heard of yours. Your Quarp Juice is a miracle, a life creating miracle! Ellie doesn't seem to really even register what Alkali has said, but she likes the praise. "Another superfan?! Whinny! I love meeting fans." Ellie gets on her knees to be eye level with the Shell, patting him on the head. "Well Mister Alkali, it's an honor to meet you too! Quarp Juice is very yummy! But I didn't invent it, silly. It puzzled me at first, but it seems to be a fictional creation in some television show. The juice thhhhough is very real, and since your name is on the product, it is clear thhhhat it is your creation! No self respecting scientist would let someone else to take credit for somethhhhing as marvelous as it. Ahem. event.name: ALKALI_SURRENDER
event.text: "That is enough! You will hand over the target at once and you will leave this system! This is an order!"

event.name: SURRENDERED_ALKALI
event.text: You send over the Shell scientist to the Rebels, who collect him and carry him away. After this, you're certain they'll alert the fleet of your location. Let's hope that still gives you enough time to leave...

event.name: ALKALI_LEGION
event.text: As you begin to depart from the station, a Rebel ship jumps in, but it's not like any Rebel design you remember in your debriefing. Renegades, Elites, MFK Aces, Engineers, none of them bear that logo... A yellow helmet, with the word Legion on it, stands out to you. Is this some new Rebel fleet?

You receive a hail from the Rebel vessel. "Federation. Under any other occasion, I would not hesitate to destroy you. However, we are here on important business. Hand over the scientist, and you will be permitted to leave. Fail to do so, and we will pull him from the hands of your mangled corpses. Attempting to leave this beacon without handing over the target will be met with failure. We have already disabled your long range FTL drive."

"Then you leave us no choice. Do not worry. You won't live long enough to regret this decision." True to their word, it appears your FTL drive has been sabotaged! Your engines will still function, but you won't be able to jump until the Rebels are dead!

Alkali protests, but he isn't going to argue with the barrel of a gun to his forehead. The Rebels board your ship in a concerningly large number, injecting a tranquilizer into Alkali and carting him off. You expect them to turn on you, but nothing happens. Instead, the Rebels head back to their ship and jump away, leaving you dumbfounded.

event.name: ALKALI_LEGION_DEFEATED
event.text: The Rebel vessel has been defeated, leaving behind plenty of scrap matter and an unusually high-tech weapon. Surprisingly, you still detect faint life signs aboard the wreck as you scrap it...

You move closer, tearing open the cargo bay to find a wounded Rebel soldier. As soon as you approach he panics, reaching for a sharp piece of metal, and plunges it deep into his chest. An act of suicide, likely trying to stop you from getting information... but on what?

Seems most of the data on the ship was purged during the fight - a strange practice, but it seems they knew their fate before the fight had even begun. Whatever this ship was, it was under very clear orders not to let anything leak. Maybe this won't be the last time you see a ship like this, though that's very uncertain.
